content: Created `/mnt/data/pyproject.toml` with minimal build metadata and tooling configuration (ruff + pytest) to make the repository skeleton initialization workflow reproducible and consistent.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path
import json

target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('pyproject.toml')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = [
"""[build-system]
requires = ["setuptools>=68", "wheel"]
build-backend = "setuptools.build_meta\"""",
"""[project]
name = "outputs-repo-skeleton"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Utilities and documentation for generating a versioned repository skeleton in the outputs directory."
readme = "README.md"
requires-python = ">=3.10"
license = {text = "MIT"}
authors = [{name = "Project Contributors"}]
classifiers = [
  "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
  "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
  "Programming Language :: Python :: 3 :: Only",
]""",
"""[tool.ruff]
line-length = 88
target-version = "py310"
extend-select = ["I"]  # import sorting via ruff
fix = true

[tool.ruff.lint]
select = ["E", "F", "I", "UP", "B"]
ignore = ["E203"]""",
"""[tool.pytest.ini_options]
addopts = "-q"
testpaths = ["tests"]""",
]

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')

print('FILE_WRITTEN:pyproject.toml')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created `/mnt/data/pyproject.toml` with minimal build metadata and tooling configuration (ruff + pytest) to make the repository skeleton initialization workflow reproducible and consistent.
